intro: Elytraria crenata var. lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated elytraria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are small, clustered flower clusters. This variety is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils.
